website_summaries.verdict: An affordable 700W blender with plenty of settings to blend a variety of ingredients.
pros: Large 40-ounce glass pitcher makes it easy to see what you're blending
Long cord allows you to place it nearly anywhere on your counter
Durable design that's easy to clean and comes with a 3-year warranty
cons: Not the best option for crushing ice or other frozen ingredients

customer_reviews.title: ... was concerned because some of these reviews were just horrible. I bought these to make smoothies
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned because some of these reviews were just horrible. I bought these to make smoothies. I don't use frozen fruit (fresh fruit only-cut up into pieces) and I use small ice cubes, not the big blocks you usually get from ice trays. So far, I've had NO issues with this blender. Blends everything, no chunks and the pouring spout is great. I've also used it few times, and haven't experienced any issues. For the price, it's a good blender.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Getting more than you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I know what you're expecting from this blender, given the price. Don't be too quick to judge! While this blender is not one of those several-hundred-dollar, fancy-shmancy, pulverize your keys and silverware blenders, it can make some amazing things for you at home! There are two different pulse settings, making chopping more evenly a breeze. The milkshake button makes a smooth shake! Ice crushing is no challenge. No burning motor smells. Super easy clean-up with a self-cleaning button! For the price, this blender really has it all! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: pirate89RAWR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for smoothies....for a few times then poops out
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Better than the other one I had that broke in less than a year...to back I didn't realize it had a 2 year warranty. That's ok! I like this one better...it really mixes well. UPDATING!!!! I'm shocked....after a few times being used this no longer blends.....tried to make a smoothie today and would not "grind" frozen fruit. I'll give it another try otherwise...I have no choice but to return it!
customer_reviews.author: Kirasheba

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with cracked base, which leaked. Will see how replacement is. .... The replacement arrive promptly , but the base which is poorly designed with cheap plastic, cracked in multiple places with simple daily use blending liquids(not even hard stuff). There's no use replacing something that is poorly designed again. If you use this product more than 14 times, it is likely to break. I wo'nt be buying anything Hamilton Beach again. I replaced it with a different Brand on the shelf at Target.
customer_reviews.author: George Washington

customer_reviews.title: Broke / blew up after two uses
customer_reviews.text: First time we used it, it was terrific. We thought we'd made a terrific purchase at a great price. Second time, the motor struggled to blend milk and frozen blueberries. Third time, would not turn out, and, after repeated tries to get it to operate, sparks flew out of the back. Dead. On its way back to Amazon now. Thank god for Prime return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Z

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it..
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't ask for more! It does look bigger in the pictures, but as I always say, please check the specs of the product before buying. Not disappointed at all! It is a great product, easy to use, works as described and better! It is worth it if you want to make some smoothies and juices..
customer_reviews.author: Alito Smith

customer_reviews.title: Barely made it past a year :(
customer_reviews.text: Well this was great while it lasted...barely over a year....until the bottom detached WHILE it was blending causing it to basically explode all over my kitchen (see the photo). This could have been very dangerous. I'd really like my money back or a replacement. Do NOT recommend this blender, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Guidry

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Hamilton Beach used to make reliable products
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year. Don't blend much. Wanted to mix some onions and herbs into hamburger to make a paste. Put in the ingredients, about 1/4 full, put on the lid. Set it to blend and it ran about 10 seconds and smoke came out the base and that was it. The model and series I think are 54220 and A2971CE (white lettering on the base). It was made in China. It was about $28 so I wasn't expecting much, but I wasn't expecting a fire hazard. Very disappointed. Hamilton Beach used to make reliable products.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this inexpensive blender
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this inexpensive blender. After 6 months, I've been pleasantly surprised with its blending ability and options. I use it daily for my smoothies which always consist of frozen fruit and greens. If you follow the directions and put your liquids in first, followed by yogurt/etc, and finally frozen on top, it does the trick. Very happy I was able to spend a fraction of the price on a blender that's actually working for me.
customer_reviews.author: MotoBonnie

customer_reviews.title: Base ring breaks
customer_reviews.text: So I have not came been using this blender for a year and the base ring has broken in several places. The pitcher is glass which is fantastic but the base of the glass is a hard plastic which has broken into several pieces. Besides that the blending is ok. I bought it to make shakes but it does not blend the frozen strawberries completely down. I end up with chunks of strawberry in my shake.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great..
customer_reviews.text: This blender is good but not great. The blending power is good however the blades dull very quickly. It comes with three blades, BUT BEWARE they come out super easy and if you are not careful you can and WILL get hurt (lol I've been there). It is super easy to clean and use and it is super big! Although this is not the best blender, it's pretty cheap and a good value. Also, noise level is pretty high so if you want to blend during the morning or at night, it can be annoying. I give this blender a 3/5!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product is a normal blender talked up to be something special!! Ii is NOT!! Does NOT suck things down, you need to push them down with a wooden spoon. Once it actually starts doing something, it works pretty normal. BUT, getting it to do something is a chore. It just sits there and spins making a lot of noise!! I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. The speeds are so close together that you only notice a difference between low and high. AND low is NOT very slow!!
customer_reviews.author: Tall Drink of Water

customer_reviews.title: works great crushing the ice in my slim fat drink
customer_reviews.text: I have used this blender for over a year now. Although it doesn't crush larger pieces of ice very well, it does a great job of chomping up smaller ice pieces, aka mini ice cubes. I have used it on the 4,5, and 6th settings with ease. I t is a true bargain for me It is easy to clean up and I like that it has a glass container, not plastic,
customer_reviews.author: C. Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Blends well, but tiny!
customer_reviews.text: So, I should have paid more attention to the specs, but this is TINY! I thought it was a full size blender. Other than that, it gets the job done for a smoothie.
customer_reviews.author: Williams

customer_reviews.title: Crusher of expectations
customer_reviews.text: While there are some definite PROS (thick glass container, sturdy lid that fits snugly, ease of attaching container to base, snap tight spout for adding liquid or small ingredients while blending), the one big CON is that it doesn't do a good job. In my experience, it actually just blends; in the same way that a whisk would do. I'm a big fan of low budget blenders; they work for my simple needs. I just need it to make smoothies from both frozen ingredients & fresh. I always add plenty of liquid, so that's not an issue. The issue is this just can't handle blending ingredients in a non-chunky way. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: B. Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a damaged NutriBullet
customer_reviews.text: When my 6-month-old NutriBullet began to shed black specks and they refused to back their warranty or resolve the situation, I went searching for a replacement. I'm all about my daily morning smoothie, but I didn't want to spend a ton of money. I did a fair amount of research and read the reviews, before I decided on the Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher Blender. So far, so good. It was a great value and has held up to every piece of frozen fruit and countless ice cubes I like to add. I clean the pitcher in the dishwasher every week, too. I have no complaints and can highly recommend this blender.
customer_reviews.author: simonsmom

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blender and so far it's failed at everything I've tried to make with it. I've tried frozen drinks, I've tried hummus, I've tried marinades, I've tried milkshakes. The blender can't even make a vortex; it just throws everything away from the blades and forms an air pocket. I love HB's rice cookers, but I'll never buy another one of their blenders. I tossed this one in the trash today without ever being able to use it successfully. I gave it 1 star, because it wouldn't let me give zero.
customer_reviews.author: Sean H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for smoothies
customer_reviews.text: I love my blender! I read a lot of blender reviews before I settled on this one. My biggest concern was the ice crushing for smoothies. I haven't had a problem, but I make sure I put the liquid and ice first and then add other ingredients. It does have that nice "wave" action that pulls everything from the top down to make sure it gets blended. For the price, it really can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy39Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Lid Not level. Not snug fit -update- got lid to fit.
customer_reviews.text: Just got today. Lid does not snap on snugly, whether vent and spout open or closed. Seems to float up a little. Anyone else have this? I will have to hold lid while using. I worked at it for a while and got the lid to level out. Shouldn't have been so hard to do, but all's well that ends well.
customer_reviews.author: Puzzle Lover

customer_reviews.title: shaky buttons
customer_reviews.text: I like this blender and have used it a handful of times already. However, I forgot how much trouble Hamilton Beach products have given me in the past. My only concern (and I wouldn't get anything from HB without having a warranty on it) is that while you're making your smoothie, the whole row of buttons shake? I'm so sorry my Oster didn't work out. I'm hoping this one will. I have no intention of returning... not yet anyway. I do enjoy the smoothies it makes.
customer_reviews.author: Sal129

customer_reviews.title: Adequate - but barely
customer_reviews.text: I got this mainly to make my summer gazpacho. It takes a lot of poking and prodding initially to get the vegetables blended enough to really swirl around the glass on their own. And there are sizable pieces of vegetable left even after running on the highest speed for a while. This use may be beyond the intended mission for this appliance, but I was hoping it would do a better job. Still, my gazpacho tastes good and refreshing on a hot summer day.
customer_reviews.author: CoudeCasse

customer_reviews.title: Great blending power
customer_reviews.text: This is so good that when it broke, we bought another. It is powerful for a kitchen blender and is easy to clean up and does as well as blenders costing much more (Ok it is not a Vitamix but then for under %30 we didn't expect that) 😁 Other blenders have had to have gaskets continually replaced but not this on. Same gaskets for 4 years If you need a blender this is a great value
customer_reviews.author: Rick Grunwald

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this to make breakfast protein shakes after my 20 year old blender stopped working. I use sliced frozen bananas and this blender even using the crushed ice setting takes way too long 2 blend the bananas and often there are big chunks left in the shake. My older blender shredded and blended the bananas quickly
customer_reviews.author: Vicki D.

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good blender all around. The container is short & wide, so more compact than my last blender. But the real reason I bought a blender is for noise level. My last one sounded like a car grinding gears and this one purrs like a cat.
customer_reviews.author: David Mutina

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Bottom after One Year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blender a little over a year ago and used it approximately three to four times a week. About a week ago, it started leaking from the bottom no matter how hard I screwed the blade piece and seal ring together. Overall, It was a reliable device for a solid year, but it seems that’s just how long it will last. Now, it’s completely useless unless I don’t mind splashing milk across my counter every time I want a shake.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy R.

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend buying - It does not last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blender in November 2019 and it just died on me today which is now May 2020. The blender worked great for the time being, although it is pretty loud. I used it every day (minus a couple days here and there) to blend smoothies, but then it stopped working today. The drive gear that spins the blades is made out of plastic and has essentially shredded apart and will no longer spin the blades. My recommendation if you use a blender every day is to NOT buy this blender and instead buy one that has a drive gear made out of metal.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product all aroung:  Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher 54220 blender
customer_reviews.text: This was very inexpensive, but it does everything and does it very good. I have gone through blender after blender. This is a sturdy one and it is just the right size. I can put it out of sight and get it out because it fits just right. I have used it for a dozen different things and each time I am delighted at how easy it is to use. Buy it you wont be disappointed. H. P. Oldershaw
customer_reviews.author: Helen P. Oldershaw

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender! I love this blender! I cannot use my food processor because I can't get the lid on correctly. I use this instead. Nice glass jar. Easy marked measurements on the jar. Nice lid. Every thing fits well! I'm enamored of this blender! My food processor will languish and this blender will be my go-to! I made pesto tonight and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficulty cleaning
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blender except that it is very difficult to clean. Small items get wedged at the bottom and I have to scratch them out with a sharp object. If the items are sticky, then I need to soak in bleach to make sure I've dissolved and cleaned everything out.
customer_reviews.author: Samuraineko

customer_reviews.title: Not for Frozen Fruit Smoothies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to use with frozen and fresh fruits/veggies for smoothies. It does not pull the fruit down to the blender blades so I had to constantly stop it and push the fruit down to the bottom, regardless of which setting selected or how long I left it on the base. I tried it with the store-bought frozen peaches and again with the mixed fruit. I added almond milk with the fruit. Once I pushed the fruit down, it did a good job of processing it into a smoothie.
customer_reviews.author: Grams

customer_reviews.title: Won’t crush ice
customer_reviews.text: Smoothies are a way of life for our family and our kids want them icy. So after our trusted and often times hated Ninja died we went looking for an everyday blender to handle our families needs. We found this one at a good value and it honestly does everything but crush ice well. The cover is also very difficult to get off of the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Ota

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: We needed a blender that would pulverize frozen food, e.g. bananas. The blender continued to go around not pulling frozen product into blades to mix with liquid. Secondly, the bottom screws onto pitcher, but not snugly, so liquid leaks into threads and under blade. The lid takes a genius to get it fitted tight . Overview, this blender doesn't meet our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nurgent

customer_reviews.title: Not a smoothie maker
customer_reviews.text: This is not the blender for those of us who like to add things after it begins blending. Even on the lowest setting, it spews fluid out of the top and onto the counter. I add ginseng and other goodies after the fruit and I have to turn it off to add anything.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lighty

customer_reviews.title: Works well.... make smoothies for children ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well....make smoothies for children and next model I will get one with more ice crushing power. However have been enjoying.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Walker

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, not a great machine.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent machine. The analog buttons are nice but the increments don't do very much. It's basically four slow buttons and two fast ones. The lid is the worst part of this blender. You need a pry bar to install and remove it as it fits OUTSIDE the glass. I use a snap lid from a bowl instead.
customer_reviews.author: Haamundegg

customer_reviews.title: Good but ...
customer_reviews.text: While the blender is as expected, which is quite good, the top is quite hard to remove. The suction is so tight that I have to pull repeatedly all around it and carefully so as not to break it or have the insides splatter. Meanwhile, I can't contact them due to the virus, the site has the wrong dates about their reopening customer service, and the online email form doesn't work. I know we have to be very careful to socially distance but at least some customer service can happen remotely.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great Blender for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Holding up great! Often used several times a day with fruit, veggies, and sometimes even nuts. Occasionally have to use spatula if there isn't enough liquid to get contents down to blades. Would definitely buy this one again. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Mom from Crete

customer_reviews.title: Life expectancy, 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blender July of 2015. It lasted until December 2018. I bought it mainly to crush ice for smoothies. I looked into several blenders before I purchased this one because I wanted to make sure it would crush ice easily. About a month ago it started smoking and smelling of burnt motor, when i used it and today it died. It was hard to take apart the base when it was time to clean and hard to remove the lid after using. While it lasted it worked well, but personally I felt it should have lasted several more years.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.text: I had a hamilton beach blender for 37 years. It eventually quit. I purchased this blender, had it for 2 months and the base of the glass pitcher that screws on broke. I contacted HB - no response. I contacted Amazon - they told me to contact HB - I tried - no response..... Won't buy another one of these - went out and bough an Oster at Target - where I can return it and get customer service face to face.
customer_reviews.author: TwinsMom

customer_reviews.title: Blender is loud.
customer_reviews.text: It does not blend good until you cut items into tiny pieces. This blender is very loud, and it is easy to clean. I don’t recommend this blender if your someone who does not like cutting your veggies or fruits into tiny pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Dionne K

customer_reviews.title: Great value, works well and lasts long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in January it is now almost the end of September and the blendor is used fairly regularly, mainly for smoothies and shakes... and it has given us no problems whatsoever! So pleased! always easy to clean and take apart and very easy to use I was a little concerned at 1st because the price, but this is was such a great buy! Absolutely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Giving another go with Hamilton Beach
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace my 25 year-old Hamilton Beach blender (motor was still going strong, but I dropped the plastic container and cracked it). I looked at other brands while looking for a replacement, but I had such faith in Hamilton Beach since the last one survived almost daily use for such a long time. So far, I've been very happy with my replacement. I like the new thick glass container. It's powerful enough to blend my smoothie (I sometime throw in celery and ginger) to smooth enough consistency. I'm curious to see how long the plastic parts of the container will withstand the daily use. It just feels slightly less durable than the last model I had.
customer_reviews.author: tad

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 years, Heavy glass jar, but seems to work fine
customer_reviews.text: Update: this blender lasted six years before the motor and base burned out. The glass jar is still fine, though. I recommend hand washing all the parts of this blender because if you put anything in the dishwasher, it tends to warp plastic parts and make them not fit together. Old review: This glass jar, especially when filled with liquids, is fairly heavy. And even though I thought I had chosen a large-capacity jar, this jar seems smaller than my plastic blender's. Everything seems to work okay, though.
customer_reviews.author: ttmadison

customer_reviews.title: bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my 500watt Kitchen Aid blender (dd broke the glass pitcher). All the positive reviews really helped in my decision. We make many green smoothies, so I knew it had to be able to handle ice and such. It's fantastic! I really LOVE the poor spout - it's those little things that make big impacts! My OLD BLENDER ... forget about pouring out of it - you couldn't without it getting everywhere! This one is much bang for the inexpensive buck!!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Warning
customer_reviews.text: Heads up!! Well it says it crashes ice. Not true! I was making a smoothie with mine. Well I can say it doesn’t work like I wanted it to. Took me several times to get my frozen fruit chopped up. I wouldn’t recommend getting this product it you want to make smoothies. I guess you will have to use fresh fruits. Not good with anything frozen. Just wanted you all to know. Before you go out and buy like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Could not do anything I would want a blender to do
customer_reviews.text: Could really only blend soft warm bananas into mush. In seconds the blade would burrow a hole in the food, and from there it would just spin, and overheat. I would not recommend people buy this blender for anything other than blending very soft drinks, preferably that don't use frozen fruit, as I found this difficult to do (taking over 5 minutes of blending for half a cup) without making the drink half milk or water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible black smoke immediately
customer_reviews.text: It looks and sounds like it's got power.. but it's very loud and I had only gotten to use mine for about 7 seconds. It immediately started blowing thick black smoke that smelt burnt and harsh. I turned it off, unplugged it and inspected it, it looks like it's coming from the vents in the motor underneath. Smells awful, probably isnt safe to use and had to spend 30 minutes scraping my countertop from the blanket of black dust it had laid down. Awful investment for seven seconds of use and 30 minutes of cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: The Amazon Review

customer_reviews.title: It works and is aatractive design
customer_reviews.text: Blender Hamilton Beach new version medium quality compared to earlier models . Like the design and I am going to keep it. I have an old one by Hamilton Beach thirty or more years old . Old one has a stronger motor and blending is better. My hired help likes the old one better
customer_reviews.author: Max T. Nigh

customer_reviews.title: Mine is a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Used this blender 3 times within two months to blend boiled potatoes in broth for potato leek soup. It simply could not blend. After a week attempt it went in strike permanently. Hamilton Beach does not answer the phone during normal business hours.
customer_reviews.author: rinconmx

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality product
customer_reviews.text: If you're buying this product to crush ice.... forget it!!! The super small blade hardly moves the ice, and the ice it does move is mushed, not crushed. Almost all parts are plastic except the pitcher which is nice, heavy glass. Very disappointed, and it will be returned....
customer_reviews.author: Gaylon Sperle

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great blender. All parts come apart for easy washing. I love the glass jar as it’s much easier to clean and won’t stain and get any odor like the plastic ones. Super strong. I blend fruit daily in my smoothies and I’ve never had a chunk or and issues with it chopping it into a perfectly smooth blend.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance
customer_reviews.text: This is the best blender I ever had hands down. I love the self cleaning option, especially because I have a small dishwasher. It is great for blending frozen fruits because it has two sets of blades in the bottom. The only thing I would change is Hamilton Beach’s limited warranty. I honestly wish they would stand by their products more, especially if you’re willing to invest in a quality blender.
customer_reviews.author: G523

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: What I liked is the price and the glass pitcher. What I dislike is the lid. It’s too hard for me to remove it and I have to ask for help every time I use it. I honestly wouldn’t have bought it if I had tried it in a store. I’m not going to recommend it for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Carol B.

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite kitchen gadgets
customer_reviews.text: I see everyone talking about noise level but it’s a blender so I’m not sure how people expect it to be super silent. This is such a good purchase and has many different blending options. I was originally going to buy a blender from Costco but found this one for half the price and it’s decently big but yet the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Not worth its
customer_reviews.text: This is terrible. It takes forever to try and blend up anything because it gets stuck. So I have to stop, stir, blend, over and over! It doesn’t do ice at all either, unless you like it chunky. Waste of money. I have just gone back to using my small blender.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this blender less than 6 months ago, and it is completely dead. It won't turn on, and does not respond when we push any of the buttons. What a waste of money. Our usage of the blender was not anything out of the ordinary. It was mostly just for smoothies. If anything, I'd say we used it less than a typical person because we also own a food processor. If you're considering a blender, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Flynn-Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Wider Base, Shorter Cup Makes a MUCH More Stable Blender!
customer_reviews.text: This wide base blender is a wonderful tool. I never liked really tall blender cups because they would travel across the countertop. This Hamilton Beach Blender has a variety of settings and a much wider base and shorter cup so that it's easier to add ingredients to the container. I like how effective it is at chopping up ice too!
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Its good just a simple solid blender
customer_reviews.text: Update: Well, my sister pretty much killed it by not making sure the pitcher was fully seated before pressing blend. The plastic teeth on the blender motor (part that connects to blade gear on bottom of pitcher) is almost completely worn (teeth are worn). Still sorta " works". Might try and 3D print a replacement chuck for fun because the blender is so cheap 29$....... If they made that part out of metal......this thing would last forever. ------------------ Its good just a simple solid blender. Easy to clean, i just dump soap and water in there and let it blend / rinse itself.
customer_reviews.author: NwolfZ

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It's fine but from the reviews I thought it would be better than the Proctor Silex I already had but was leaking a little. It's about the same for making smoothies and noise level. Ice cubes and big frozen strawberries are a little bit of a challenge for it just like my old one. But at least it was cheap and it's not leaking and is prettier. :) Good for a basic blender. The lid is not an issue as other reviewers stated. The size is nice.
customer_reviews.author: luckymissybuzz

customer_reviews.title: Best operating blender I ever had and Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Love the way it makes my fruit smoothie! At a very cheap price it works better than blenders 10 x the price! It does have a lot of plastic parts that the more expensive ones have stainless steel parts! Time will tell how long it lasts but for now it’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: mustangsteve

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I think its hard to beat. I wanted a ninja or a bullet, but this is third the price, and does waht I need it to do: crush ice and make smoothie type drinks. You still get the seeds of raspberries at the bottom, so it could grind finer, but I don't really mind. Crushes Ice very well. My biggest gripe, if I have one, is the lid is so tight! Its good because it is not going to come off during blending, but when its time to clean, FML, I need to break a sweat to pry the lid off the glass mixer thing. Hoping it will loosen up a bit with use.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Oropeza

customer_reviews.title: Great blender, great price
customer_reviews.text: I make a breakfast smoothie a few times a week with my blender and I'm very satisfied with it. I've had it for about a month now and it gets the job done. I've never owned a nutribullet, so i can't compare the quality, but for the price it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Ani

customer_reviews.title: It does NOT like ice very much
customer_reviews.text: It does NOT like ice very much. If I use ice chips it works ok when making smoothies but anything bigger than that comes out with lots of ice chunks still left in it. Otherwise, I will say it is a very good cheap blender for all other applications.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: For The Most Part, It Gets The Job Done.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the blender primarily to make smoothies and adult beverages. It doesn't do well with crushing ice or frozen fruit.You will have to crush the ice prior to adding it or add a couple of pieces at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent blender. Love the fact that is full size and comes with a glass container! It has several different settings and seems to get the job done without too many issues. Great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Power

customer_reviews.title: does a good job
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for the money. You can spend a lot more and probably get the same results. The pitcher is plastic which may get scratched over time but at least its lighter than the glass ones.
customer_reviews.author: garden lady

customer_reviews.title: I liked it when I first got it. After using it once it does not work properly.
customer_reviews.text: I got this blender and used it to blend up some turkey stock for Thanksgiving. I't worked great! Since then I have tried to use it to make a slushy out of flavoed ice cubes.The blade just spins and it doesn't do anything. My husband tried to blend up some dip with it and the blade just spins and nothing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Cherilynn

customer_reviews.title: Low power
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This is a pretty terrible blender but it's okay I guess for the low price. I bought this for a rental property; I would never use this as my personal blender. It has little power, crushes okay but leaves large chunks in anything you make. Average at best.
customer_reviews.author: WiseTravels47

customer_reviews.title: Not a good blender
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Honestly wasn’t expecting much and that’s exactly what I got. This is not a good blender. If you’re looking for a blender just for smoothies, than this is fine. I tried to make hummus and it couldn’t even chop through basil. It left sizable chunks even after twenty minutes of stirring then blending and more stirring and more blending. I’ll be saving up for a better blender. Do yourself a favor and don’t even bother. You’re better off spending a little bit more for much better results.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: that I hope that someone can recommend a fix for
customer_reviews.text: I used this blender twice to make smoothies in it and it worked well. I do have an issue, that I hope that someone can recommend a fix for, or I may have to return the blender. When I put the glass jar into the base to use for the second time, I can't remove the plastic bottom of the jar. So when I pulled out the jar, it was just the jar and the blades. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Shynsweet

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work for smoothies
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted it to make smoothies and that's it and she spends more time hand mixing her ingredients, basically a waste of money for me hopefully it does something good for others.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: you got what you pay
customer_reviews.text: at the very first I summited a good review, but after the time the blender started making noise and I decided to return it, I will look for better options eaay to clean is a plus
customer_reviews.author: Fernando G

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: If I could still return this, I would. Rarely use it because the "curves" of the glass make it annoying & sometimes impossible to get all the food out. Annoying to clean. I also feel it doesn't truly do all the supposed settings claim it does. It's just average. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: sophie's mom

customer_reviews.title: It's not a juicer
customer_reviews.text: I'll blame myself. I should have researched better before purchase. If you're looking for a juicer, this device won't work. I thought I could just throw some celery and apples in it. Don't be like me. Research for the correct blender/juicer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Toye

customer_reviews.title: Hoping for more....
customer_reviews.text: Standard blender - bought to make fruit smoothies - it doesn't like frozen bananas. Ice crushing ability is lacking. All the blended ingredients stay in the bottom of the pitcher and you have to keep stop and stir the contents to get everything blended. Does not like anything "thick".
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hermes

customer_reviews.title: Not your mamma's blender!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT all around machine. People have asked about the noise-----really folks-----is that a major concern? It's a blender! If you like smoothies...this machine makes it easy. Never had a lump or a clump. It is capable of crushing ice cubes, frozen fruits and veggies. It makes a nice an creamy consistency, comparable to any ice cream/smoothie you may get at a restaurant. VERY easy to clean, use, and enjoy. I highly recommend. You cannot do better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: THEY (?) LIED
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after searching high and low, the only one that said "MADE IN USA" Guess what! It is made in China. They lied! It looks like a nice product, but, that is not the point. So now if you want to support the few USA made products left out there, you get lied to. Unbelievable!
customer_reviews.author: Mar J.

customer_reviews.title: Waist of electricity
customer_reviews.text: This was such a disappointment...I had chunks of bell pepper in my seasoning after I tried blending it multiple times. Waist of my time and electricity, very frustrating. Getting my money back. Didn't even want a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's a good value.
customer_reviews.text: It does what a blender should do, but it's not as compact or as powerful asI expected it to be, which is probably more my problem than the blender's. Overall it's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: apasitolento

customer_reviews.title: Best little machine in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I continue to purchase this blender as they wear out . Great little blender for the money It has great power. I use for smoothies daily.i swear by this one.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHANIE M TERRY

customer_reviews.title: First time reveiw
customer_reviews.text: First time product review, returning product. I had to strain everthing. Pulivrizes ice back into water . Don't ask me lol. First attempt was a smoothie . Apple.chia leaves.ginger.ice.and water(which I don't want to add .But I wouldn't have blended other wise. I actually used a steam colendar strain. Those holes are not small and I still had a good amount of what I blended in the colendar. And was left with mess and juice.
customer_reviews.author: dominique

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: this is my first blender and its amazing! i blend all my smoothies in it and its the perfect thing ever! highly recommend 10/10 it's cute , thick glass
customer_reviews.author: ashley covarrubias

customer_reviews.title: Poor blending ability
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blender to make smoothies with liquid, ice and fruit. Unfortunately it does not crush ice the way it claims and barely cuts the fruits up. This item would be able to blend liquids and powders together, but not any solid item like foods or ice.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R.

customer_reviews.title: Bleaner Breezin
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my old blender who finally died. I love that the Wavecrusher is a glass container and cleans up easily and that it has multiple speeds. I blend multiple juices, vegetables and ice cubes simultaneously for smoothies without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: linda roberts

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed on the power of this blender I feel it takes longer to blend my smoothies than the ninja I previously owned. I mean it does the job just take longer and well can’t complain too much it is easy to clean and the price was great!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job. Much sturdier than my older, more expensive blender. It is noisy but I’m not sure how to quiet one can be when crushing ice.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bratton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: We use our blender for soups and smoothies, and this unit provides a very fine puree. The pitcher has a wide bottom, which makes this the easiest to clean of any blenders we've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lee

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at how powerful this little blender is
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at how well this blender works for the price. I have a very easy time making my meal replacement smoothies at work. It will grind the ice and frozen berries very easily along with blending everything well. The only reason I gave it a 4/5 for easy to clean is due to the fact I have a hard time getting my flaxseed to come off the sides and out of the very bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Brittnee

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old blender that still worked but was LOUD. This is a nice improvement. Works well and the noise level is less
customer_reviews.author: Tilda

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Lid is so tight i cant get it off. Wont crush up ice for a smoothie
customer_reviews.author: Kathi Seger

customer_reviews.title: Smoothies!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Saw Jennifer Anniston making a smoothie in her Aveeno ad, so of course I got this. (I chose a well known brand blender). But how to make a smoothie? So I went to the App Store on my iPhone and got the Martha Stewart app which has some nice recipes for many things including smoothies. Who wouldn't want to look like Jennifer Anniston? She's healthy and smart!! The blender is kinda loud but for 45 seconds not a real drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Beauty queen

customer_reviews.title: Not even enough power to blend frozen fruit!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible power and it's so loud that my neighbors know when I am making smoothies. It gets the job done coupled with my blood, sweat and tears. I'll be purchasing a blender with more power and I'll keep this one to blend sand. :o/
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price. I like that it has the large glass jar, it can really hold a lot. However, just keep in mind, this isn't a high end blender. It's not going to shop everything to a fine liquid. I eat a raw diet so I make a lot of smoothies and this left them still fairly chunky. Not bad, but definitely chunky. Other than it not being a super powerful motor it's a great blender with various speeds. If you want a fully liquified blend, you'll have to step it up with a Vitamix or a Ninja or something equiv.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: LID ONCE YOU GET IT ON AND SECURE IS HARD TO GET OFF
customer_reviews.text: NOT MADE FOR HARD USE, PARTS PLASTIC, AND AS I SAID BEFORE A 300 LB SUMO WRESTLER CAN NOT GET THE LID OFF TO POUR..YOU HAVE TO HOLD IT UNDER HOT WATER TO PRY IT OFF..
customer_reviews.author: L J S

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this blender.
customer_reviews.text: Effortless to use, a cinch to clean, and very little of the spray leakage I've experienced with other blenders.
customer_reviews.author: Rand B. Lee

customer_reviews.title: It works for good  for smoothies and crushed ice
customer_reviews.text: It's a good blended. Crushes ice for drinks nicely. I mainly use it for smoothies. It's a good basic blender at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Anderson

customer_reviews.title: blender
customer_reviews.text: I like it it works great when you get your fruit moving other than that it works great not bad price either
customer_reviews.author: james r bailey

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I bought this blender!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has difficulty swallowing and I need to puree his food. This blender does NOT grab the food along the sides and mix it, I have to stop, take the lid off, scrap the sides, and puree again. It could not mix spaghetti, scrambled eggs, or milk shakes. I'm extremely sorry I bought this blender. I am now looking for other products that can actually help do what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Danita H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works well for smoothies
customer_reviews.text: It works well for frozen fruit and spinach. It is very loud, but most blenders are. Easy to clean .
customer_reviews.author: Rachael and Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Worked for several months and then died
customer_reviews.text: I used this daily for smoothies and it worked ok. Not great just ok. Now I can't get it to blend frozen fruit. It started to smell like it was burning so I figured the motor was dead and tossed it right out. Would not buy another Hamilton Beach product.
customer_reviews.author: couldbutwont

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher Blender with 40oz Glass Jar and 14 Functions for Puree, Ice Crush, Shakes and Smoothies, Stainless Steel (54221)
product_meta.description: Color:Stainless SteelHamilton Beach Blenders are known worldwide for making smooth and delicious blended drinks. Over the years, people have relied on Hamilton Beach for perfect icy drinks, shakes, smoothies, and the innovation that this historic brand is famous for. Usage of more frozen foods (fruit, ice cream, etc.) than liquids leads to the foods sticking to the sides of blender jars or the mixture becomes stiff (frozen) and will not flow.
feature_bullets: Crushes Ice With Ease: Patented Ice Sabre Blades Combined With a Powerful 700 Watt Peak Power Motor Crushes Contents Quickly for Smooth, Icy Drinks.

Smooth Results: Ordinary Blenders Spin Contents Around the Walls of the Jar, Which Can Leave Whole Chunks Untouched by the Blades, but Our Patented Waveaction System Is Designed to Continually Force the Mixture Down Into the Blades for Consistently Smooth Results Without Stirring.

Heat Resistant Glass Jar: The 40 Ounce Glass Jar Is Thermal Shock Tested to Withstand Extreme Temperature Changes. It Is Perfect for Parties or Making a Pitcher of Shakes and Smoothies That the Whole Family Can Enjoy.
MIX, Puree, Ice Crush and More With Drip-Free Serving: 14 Blending Functions Handles a Variety of Blending Needs. Plus Enjoy No-Mess Serving With an Easy-Pour Spout Designed to Eliminate Drips.
Easy to Clean: The Lid, Blades and Glass Jar Are Dishwasher Safe and the Base Comes With Storage for the Cord.
3-Year Warranty: Backed by a 3-Year Warranty, the Durable Motor Is Life-Tested to Blend 8,000 Frozen Drinks.
Stainless Finish: Sleek Stainless Steel Finish Looks Great on Your Countertop.
Included Components: 40-Pound Thermal Shock Resistant Jar

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,504 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
